pages.text: So you've gotten some latex by tapping specific tropical trees... Congratulations! Latex by itself doesnt do much, but by processing it we can get some very useful byproducts!$(br2)If you havent obtained Latex producing Trees, you can look at the Tapping Index entry!

pages.title: A sticky substance
pages.text: To begin, At the very least a Bucket of Latex needs to be processed in a $(l:firmalife/oven_appliances#vat)Vat$() or a $(l:mechanics/pot)Pot$() alongside some $(thing)Sulfur$(), this will create Sticky Resin.

pages.title: Sticky Business
pages.text: $(thing)Sticky Resin$() has a number of usages, thanks to it being well... sticky, it can be used to create multiple items such as Tapes and Sticky Pistons, but more importnatly, it can be used to create $(thing)Resin Circuit Boards$() and $(thing)Resistors$(), which will be your first electrical components.

pages.title: Extraction
pages.text: Utilizing an $(thing)Extractor$(), you can proceed to extract $(thing)Raw Rubber Pulp$(), this pulp can then be placed inside an $(thing)Alloy Smelter$() with a bit of $(thing)Sulfur$() to create $(thing)Rubber Ingots$()
$(thing)Rubber Ingots$() have a number of uses, It's mainly used to $(bold)Insulate$() $(thing)electrical wires$(), making them safe to touch without accidentally electrocuting yourself.
